1.brief: to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, a pithy maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a simile (as an adage, poem, discourse)

2.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

3.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
a lamp (i.e. the burner) or light (literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness

4.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, the crop gathered, i.e. (by implication) the autumn (and winter) season; figuratively, ripeness of age
a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

5.brief: properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)

6.brief: to lave (the whole or a part of a thing)
a walk, i.e. (by implication) a step
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
to pour out, i.e. (figuratively) smelt, utter
a rill (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation)
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness

7.brief: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
an opening, i.e. door or gate
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
a seat; figuratively, a site; abstractly, a session; by extension an abode (the place or the time); by implication, population

8.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)

9.brief: a head person (of any rank or class)
to inclose; by analogy, to hold back; also to maintain, rule, assemble
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

10.brief: a commander (as occupying the front), civil, military or religious; generally (abstractly, plural), honorable themes
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)
properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to be straight (used in the widest sense, especially to be level, right, happy); figuratively, to go forward, be honest, proper
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to duplicate or repeat; by implication, to protest, testify (as by reiteration); intensively, to encompass, restore (as a sort of reduplication)

12.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to surround, i.e. protect or aid

13.brief: properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a widow; also a desolate place
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)

14.brief: the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
a robe (i.e. upper and outer garment)
a head-dress (i.e. piece of cloth wrapped around)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

15.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

16.brief: father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately

17.brief: properly, a biter, i.e. a tooth
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food

18.brief: adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a nest (as fixed), sometimes including the nestlings; figuratively, a chamber or dwelling
to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

19.brief: to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
near, with or among; often in general, to
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)

20.brief: properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change

21.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope
to be dumb; by implication, to be astonished, to stop; also to perish
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence

22.brief: properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fold, i.e. duplicate (literally or figuratively); by implication, to transmute (transitive or intransitive)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to ooze, i.e. distil gradually; by implication, to fall in drops; figuratively, to speak by inspiration
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic

23.brief: to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to yawn, i.e. open wide (literally or figuratively)

24.brief: to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
near, with or among; often in general, to
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)

25.brief: properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)
